content: this new web framework spends quite a bit of space in the announcement talking about how well it works with rust-analyzer :big_smile: https://dioxuslabs.com/blog/introducing-dioxus/#:~:text=Dioxus%20is%20perfected%20for%20the%20IDE
Ohhhh that looks interesting. Might try porting caniuse.rs over to it (currently uses Yew)
IDE issues are definitely an annoyance with Yew

Oh noes. Throughout my life I was telling people "please don't write macros cause they break IDEs" and now (thanks to @Edwin Cheng , @Jonas Schievink [he/him], @Lukas Wirth and many other folks) this excuse doesn't work :sob:
If you want to be nitpicky you could still say macros break some IDE features like inlay hints(though I have an idea for that one r-a#11183) :silence:
